channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As federal funds wane, NPR ruefully clashes with CPB
item.description: NPR asked a federal judge to block CPB from awarding a $57.9 million grant to a new consortium of public media institutions to operate the satellite t...

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to withhold $4 billion in foreign aid
item.description: The court's majority said Trump's foreign policy authority outweighed the harms claimed by the international aid groups suing.

item.title: Midtown Manhattan mass shooting gunman had low-stage CTE, medical examiner finds
item.description: Shane Tamura, the gunman who killed four people in a deadly Midtown Manhattan shooting, had low-stage CTE, officials said Friday.

item.title: Elon Musk and Prince Andrew named in new Epstein files
item.description: The documents by the estate of convicted paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein were released by Congressional Democrats.

item.title: 9/26: CBS Morning News
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey indicted; Texas teen confesses to stabbing twin in 911 call.

item.title: Humberto grows to major hurricane in the Atlantic. Maps show its forecast path.
item.description: Humberto rapidly strengthened into a major hurricane as it churned over the Atlantic Ocean, the National Hurricane Center said.

item.title: Bondi vows to send Justice Department agents to guard ICE facilities
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi said she has ordered DOJ agents to guard ICE facilities — and directed counterterrorism task forces to look into attacks ag...

item.title: 5/26/2023: The Sperm Whales of Dominica; Monkey Island; Hanging On
item.description: First, a look at a marine sanctuary protecting sperm whales. Then, a report on Hurricane Maria’s impact on Monkey Island. And, learning how sloths sur...

item.title: An influx of federal agents will arrive in Memphis next week, governor says
item.description: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee said National Guard troops will serve in support roles to local law enforcement and not be tasked with making arrests.

item.title: Assata Shakur, a fugitive Black militant sought by the U.S. since 1979, dies in Cuba
item.description: Assata Shakur, a Black liberation activist who was given political asylum in Cuba after her 1979 escape from a U.S. prison, has died. Officials in New...

item.title: There was a different vibe at the U.N. General Assembly. 5 attendees weigh in
item.description: It's the first high level U.N. gathering since the U.S. foreign aid cuts under the Trump Administration. What were people thinking — and talking about...

item.title: Sinclair and Nexstar to reinstate Kimmel on ABC stations
item.description: Viewers in Washington, DC, St Louis and Seattle will be able to watch the late night comedian's show again.

item.title: ICE officer disciplined after shoving woman to ground in courthouse
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security said the officer's behaviour was "unacceptable" and placed him on leave.

item.title: Assata Shakur, black liberation activist exiled in Cuba, dies at 78
item.description: She fled to Cuba after being convicted in the killing of a police officer but denied the shooting.

item.title: Man admits in TV interview to killing and burying his parents
item.description: A man admitted to killing and burying his parents eight years ago in the backyard of their upstate New York home during a television interview this we...

item.title: Watch: How Trump and Comey's relationship soured
item.description: The indictment of the ex-FBI boss comes days after Trump called for his adversaries to be more aggressively investigated.

item.title: Tennessee governor says more federal agents to join fight against crime in Memphis next week
Transportation Department tightens noncitizen truck driver rules after fatal crash in Florida
